data.title: Melissa Adamchik on LinkedIn: This is important to know. Take note friends.

data.text:

This event has seen over 200 in attendance and 40ish different resources the each of the last two years. https://lnkd.in/gZFkqghQ

Bring Back the Romance in your Marriage ‚ù§Ô∏è Couples Retreat: The Perfect Way to Rejuvenate Your Relationship. üòò Couples retreats are a great way to reconnect with your partner, learn new communication skills, and address any issues that may be affecting your relationship. They offer a safe and supportive environment where you can focus on each other without the distractions of everyday life. Couples' Retreat Cancun May 25-31, 2024 https://lnkd.in/gJ4e8S4q Amita ‚ù§Ô∏è Ghosh #couplesretreat #cancuncouplesretreat #gottmansseverprinciples #marriagesuccess #marriagetips #marriagecoaching #resolvecounselingandconsulting

If only a post could play for you; could envelop you in the joyous wisdom of great minds, the cosmos, music and wonder. Until Brian Raphael Nabors writes his new music for Mindful Music Moments and Asa Featherstone, IV creates his short film about the program, until UpSpring youth explore themes of wonder, awe and space this summer, until then, you will just need to imagine for yourself the glorious evening we had with Alan Lightman, Brian, Asa, Dean Regas and the Antigone Quartet. Thanks to Deogracias Lerma for capturing the event with these photos.

Tickets for the UpSpring Benefit Bash are now on sale! Visit the link below to purchase tickets today and support our mission to elevate local children experiencing homelessness. The Benefit Bash will be held on Saturday, April 13th, at Great American Ball Park. The night will feature dinner, open bar, live music, silent auction, live auction, raffle, and more. We can‚Äôt wait to see you there! Go to onecau.se/upspring24 to get your tickets today! #usbb24 #fundraiser #homlessyouth #cincinnati #northernkentucky

The results are in! Our 26th summer camp for children experiencing homelessness in Greater Cincinnati and Northern Kentucky was a success! Almost all of our students retained or increased their social-emotional skills (95%), and a majority of children retained or improved their math (76%) and literacy (80%) skills. Thank you to Dr. Heidi Kloos and her research team from the Children's Cognitive Research Lab at University of Cincinnati for spending another summer with our kiddos! We are grateful to all of our community partners, donors, staff, interns, and volunteers who made UpSpring Summer 360¬∞ possible. Read the full report at https://lnkd.in/gyxvseZv (graphic design generously provided by Madly Good, photos by Angie Lipscomb Photography) üíõ
